column4: how do I install pppoeconf from a 9.04 cdrom?  I cannot access the internet at the moment
you using Gnome or at a terminal?
I can use either.  I tried sudo apt-cdrom add, and it said it could not find the cdrom
it gnome ppp is installed already
No, it will not connect to my dsl modem
DLS modem does not use pppoe (that's the dialup program)
double click on your network icon on the menu bar
I cannot.  I am in Windows because I have no net access
click "enable networking"
I did all that.  I set my username and password.
did you install ubuntu?
yes, via wubi
oh wubi!  wubi= BAD!
so, never mind trying then, correct?
wait
https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+question/56844 - part way down are instructions to disabling IPV6
ok, but will I still need to install pppoeconf?

that ipv6 solution did not work, so I rebooted from the live CD and all works just fine with the modem.  Even my keyboard was not working correctly under a Wubi install.  I guess that was not the way to go.  No I have to figure out how to uninstall the Wubi installation and dual boot with Vista
I think you can uninstall wubi like a regular window program - control panel, remove software
yeah, I thought so.  I'll give it a shot.  Hopefully it does not hurt my Vista installation.  I'm not ready to wipe it off quite yet.
http://wubi-installer.org/faq.php
thanks for your help!
your welcome! :)
